oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Belle Meade United Primitive Baptist Church, 2000 December
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Belle Meade United Primitive Baptist Church, located at 1018 Forty Second Avenue North in Nashville, Tennessee. This church was built in 1965, while the congregation was formed in 1891. The denomination of the congregation is Primitive Baptist. The exterior walls of the church are red brick. The roof is gabled and made of shingles. The windows are comprised of colored glass, while the front entrance has a set of double glass doors. Special features include a basement entryway. The church also includes two additions to the main building: a front vestibule and an addition to the rear of the structure. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Belle Meade United Primitive Baptist Church (Nashville, Tenn.)
